name: Buddy Goggles
description: glasögon för din familiar!!!!

name: Sidekick Jacket
description: kallt nere i grottorna? frukta icke. Denna lilla jacka passar på alla slags familiars.

name: Endless Satchel
description: En helt normal bag of holding, fast mkt mkt glittrigare

name: Gold Trinket
description: such a cute trinket. no effect just vibes.

name: Scroll of locate object
description: Describe or name an object that is familiar to you. You sense the direction to the object’s location, as long as that object is within 1,000 feet of you. If the object is in motion, you know the direction of its movement. Useable by bard, druid, cleric, paladin, ranger and wizard.

name: Gubben i Lådan
description: huvud, axlar knä och tå – gubben i lådan har fyra attacker men träffar förvånansvärt sällan. Är det värt det? Det är upp till dig. Full character sheet i samband med leverans.

name: Snuggle Cloak
description: En varm och gossig mantel som känns som att ha på sig en kram. Ibland så viskar den små komplimanger i ditt öra.

name: Mood Ring
description: En mood ring! asså klassiskern. Fast denna har ingen aning om hur du mår. Istället läser den av sinnesstämningen hos din familiar.

name: Scroll of catapult
description: Choose one object weighing 1 to 5 pounds within range that isn’t being worn or carried. The object flies in a straight line up to 90 feet in a direction you choose before falling to the ground, stopping early if it impacts against a solid surface.

name: Flame Tongue [RARE]
description: You can use a bonus action to speak this magic sword's command word, causing flames to erupt from the blade. These flames shed bright light in a 40-foot radius and dim light for an additional 40 feet. While the sword is ablaze, it deals an extra 2d6 fire damage to any target it hits. The flames last until you use a bonus action to speak the command word again or until you drop or sheathe the sword. Attune to wepon of your choice (greatsword, longsword, rapier, scimitar or shortsword).

name: Flameweaver Gloves
description: Tunna, eleganta, otroligt delikata små handsmycken. Eller a typ handske fast ändå inte. I alla fall så gör dessa små dramatiska eldspår i luften när du rör händerna. Det blir sååå fin dramatisk effekt när man gör trollkonster eller bara viftar medans man pratar.

name: Scroll of False Life
description: Bolstering yourself with a necromantic facsimile of life, you gain 1d4 + 4 temporary hit points for the duration.

name: Gloves of Goblin Tossing
description: Magiska handskar som ger dig advantage på kast med små varelser. Perfekta för slagsmål på krogen.

name: Playing cards
description: Yea that's literally it. en jävla kortlek. ha så kul!! Om du är proficient med kortlek så kan du använda bonus för att spela.

name: Mantle of the Unyielding
description: En vändbar mantel som liksom alltid fladdrar lite dramatiskt – oavsett väder. Ger dig även en liten boost på Charisma-checks i vissa formella sammanhang.

name: Scroll of Arms of Hadar
description: You invoke the power of Hadar, the Dark Hunger. Tendrils of dark energy erupt from you and batter all creatures within 10 feet of you. Each creature in that area must make a Strength saving throw. On a failed save, a target takes 2d6 necrotic damage and can’t take reactions until its next turn. On a successful save, the creature takes half damage, but suffers no other effect.

name: Studded Leather Armor
description: Made from tough but flexible leather, studded leather is reinforced with close-set rivets or spikes. Light armor. AC: 12 + Dex modifier. Weight: 13

name: Novel: Arcane Desire
description: In the city of Erelian, where magic is bound by strict laws, Aelindra, a rebellious sorceress, crosses paths with Caelen, a duty-bound paladin sworn to hunt her kind. As an ancient darkness threatens the realm, their reluctant alliance sparks a dangerous, forbidden passion. With every stolen touch and whispered secret, the line between chaos and order blurs—and the heat between them ignites a desire that could change their fates forever.

name: Eyewear of Alter Ego
description: By wearing these nonprescription glasses you will not be recognized. Individuals will have to make a DC 19 wisdom save to recognize you. You could live a completely different life for decades and no one will be the wiser. Even if someone does discover your true identity, no one will believe them as long as you wear these glasses. They might think that you are a librarian.

name: Coin Purse of Exact Change
description: This item only has the exact change for one purchase per day. It never rounds up.

name: Ring of Encumbrance
description: This cursed item will slow your movement speed by 5 ft. After 10 rounds of wearing it, damage from falling is doubled. After 5 more rounds, your movement speed is halved. After five more rounds, you have disadvantage on athletics and acrobatics check. Five rounds later, disadvantage on stealth checks.

name: Boots of Ass Kicking
description: These boots will allow you to kick more ass. Critical hit is now 1 less than usual, meaning a roll of 19 counts as Crit.

name: Thunder Duck
description: This small rubber duck grants the user to change their attack to thunder damage.

name: Mug of Infinite Refill
description: This ceramic mug refills with the last liquid poured into it once per short rest. This includes ale, healing potions, or suspicious potions brewed by a goblin. Do not use with poison unless you are absolutely sure.

name: Bag of Holding (But It's Moody)
description: Functions exactly like a regular Bag of Holding—*when it's in the mood*. Roll a d6 every time you try to retrieve an item. On a 1-3, the bag refuses to cooperate and plays emotional harp music until soothed.

name: Tome of Useless Trivia
description: This magically updated book contains facts that are 100% irrelevant to any situation you're in. Reading it grants no bonuses, but you feel *so* smug. Once per day, you may distract an NPC with a fascinating (yet pointless) tidbit.

name: Cursed Toothbrush
description: Grants +1 to Charisma checks for 24 hours after use—but every time you use it, your teeth become *just slightly too sharp*. Not enough to scare people, but enough that they comment on it. And then it’s weird. Now you look creepy.

name: Robe of Suspicious Pockets
description: This robe has 37 pockets. Only 6 are real. The others are either illusions, mimic mouths, or portals to unknown realms. Great for misdirection. Or losing your keys forever.

name: Familiar-Sized Beanbag Chair
description: A magically warming beanbag chair sized for familiars of all shapes. Grants +1 to Familiar Morale™. May also cause your bat to feel superior to everyone else in the room.

name: Helmet of Unreadable Expressions
description: This sleek helmet hides all facial expressions, making Insight checks against you have disadvantage. Downside: you also sound echoey and weird when you talk. Tradeoffs.

name: Locket of Selective Memory
description: Once per long rest, open this locket and forget one thing of your choosing. Mechanically, you’re immune to one fear effect for 1 hour—but you won’t remember your ex’s name anymore. Tragic? Convenient? You decide.

name: Earmuffs of Selective Hearing
description: Wearing these lets you choose one person whose voice you temporarily cannot hear. Useful for tavern drama, loud bards, or ignoring your party’s rogue when they have ‘ideas’.

name: Mystical Shower Cap
description: Prevents all hair-related magic from affecting you. Curses, glamours, tangles—no effect. Does not protect from actual showers. Surprisingly fashionable.

name: Tiny Horn of Mild Alarm
description: Blow this horn to emit a moderately alarming 'eep!' sound. All allies within 10 ft. are alerted to danger, but enemies must roll a Wisdom save (DC 11) or just be… confused?

name: Potion of Confident Lies
description: For 1 hour after drinking, the drinker believe every lie you tell is 100% true. Gain advantage on Deception checks. Side effects may include mild delusion.

name: Potion of Sparkle Burps
description: No magical benefit. Just causes the drinker to burp gentle glitter clouds for the next 1d4 hours. Absolutely delightful. Might annoy wizards.
